title: Judge denies unions' bid for immediate TRO blocking DOGE data access
summary: District Judge John Bates denies a temporary restraining order for labor groups challenging DOGE's access to personal data at Labor, Health, and Education departments. Despite expressing concerns about untrained DOGE personnel accessing sensitive records including medical data and whistleblower identities, Bates ruled unions failed to establish legal standing.

sources.title: Judge denies unions' bid for immediate TRO blocking DOGE data access
Judge declines to restrict DOGE's access to Labor Department systems
Federal judge denies effort to block DOGE from accessing DOL data despite 'concerns'
Judge lets DOGE access sensitive records at Labor Department
